etymology.description: Depicts two hands grasping an object
etymology.interpretation: 丮(jǐ, 'to hold') visually represents two hands holding an object, illustrating the action of grasping or holding. This makes intuitive sense as it directly depicts the act it describes.

examples.chinese: 妈妈丮着孩子(媽媽丮著孩子)，让他安全过马路(讓他安全過馬路)。
examples.pinyin: Māmā jǐ zhe háizi, ràng tā ānquán guò mǎlù.
examples.english: The mother holds the child, allowing him to cross the street safely.

examples.chinese: 他丮住方向盘(他丮住方向盤)。
